LESSON.HEADINGS: <1>First an exercise to warm up.</1> <2>Let's practice using the quotation mark.</2> <3>Now let's practice the # sign and the $ sign.</3> <4>Let's learn some more special characters.</4> <5>Finally, let's practice all those!</5>
LESSON.DESCRIPTION: The tenth lesson will introduce you to some special characters.

The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dogs. Now it's
time for all good men to come to the aid of the party.
"You low-down dog," he spat. "I knew you'd cheat."
"You stole it," he went on, "and you killed Bob!"
Pencil type #87 costs $4.72, but type #88 is $5.75.
Eraser #3 is $1.25, but type #4 is at least $2.50.
Will Bob@bob.com accept 37%? (* Note: it's very high!)
(*10% of Bob & Bob customers consume 76% of the units)
"Why can't Dombie & Fitch buy 50% of our stock?" I had
to wonder aloud. "At $5.50 per share, bob.com is a steal."
